contentStandards: The learners demonstrate understanding of addition of numbers with sums up to 100.
performanceStandards: The learners are able to perform addition of numbers with sums up to 100.
learningCompetencies: Add numbers with sums up to 100 without regrouping using concrete and pictorial models.
learningObjectives: At the end of the 45-minute period, the students should be able to add 2-digit and 2-digit numbers without regrouping.
integration: Reading and writing numerals up to 100 (Literacy).
topicContent: Pagdaragdag ng Dalawang Bilang na may 2-Digit na ang Kabuuan ay Hanggang 99 Gamit ang Counters na Walang Regrouping
references: DepEd MATATAG Mathematics 1 Curriculum Guide, Lesson Exemplar
otherResources: Flashcards, Popsicle sticks (counters), Manila paper, Marker
activePriorKnowledge: Reviewing previous lesson: Flashcard drill on simple addition (1-digit numbers like 5+4, 3+2).
lessonPurpose: Ask the students: 'If you have 12 apples and your friend gives you 15 more, how many apples do you have in total?' Today, we will learn how to add big numbers!
lessonPractice: Introduce vocabulary: Addends, Sum, Plus sign (+), Equals sign (=).
keyIdeaReading: Read a short story problem about a farmer gathering mangoes in two different baskets.
keyIdeaDevUnderstanding: Teacher models how to line up the numbers vertically. Show that we add the 'Ones' column first, then the 'Tens' column using popsicle sticks.
keyIdeaDeepUnderstanding: Group Activity: Give each group a set of 2-digit addition problems and let them solve it using their own counters.
generalization: Ask the students: 'What do we add first when adding 2-digit numbers?' (Answer: Add the ones first, then the tens).
additionalActivities: Assignment: Count 20 spoons and 15 forks at home. Add them together and write the sum in your notebook.
